original_content:
As someone notorious for not doing things the old-fashioned manual way, were not sure by [Shane] of Stuff Made Here was thinking when he promised to send out a few hundred handwritten letters. Predictably he built an automated production line for the task. Video after the break.
With handwritten and automated not being particularly compatible, [Shane] set out to create a robot to create believable handwritten letters, which is significantly harder than it may seem at first glance. It turns out that turning your handwriting into a font is too consistent to be believable, which led down the rabbit of generated handwriting. [Shane] first spend a ridiculous amount of time trying to implement a machine learning model for the task, only to find theres already an open source library good enough to fool a forensic handwriting expert.
On the robot side, [Shane] used a pen plotter from Amazon thats its actually cheaper than building one from scratch. With the handwriting taken care of, [Shane] set up an automated loading system with the industrial robot arm he also used for his CNC chainsaw. The feeders for the empty and full postcards are 3D printed with a spring-loaded mechanism to keep the top card at the same height all the time.
Although this project contained less custom hardware and software than [Shanes] other projects, it served as an excellent reminder that its unnecessary to reinvent the wheel when building a car. Its easy to get caught up in the small details of a project that dont matter much in the final implementation and usage.
title: 自動化プロダクションラインで手書きの手紙を作成するように自作ロボットを調整
body: 手書きの手紙を数百通送りたいと思った[Shane]は、自動生産ラインを構築することにし、手書き風の文字を生成するロボットも作りました。文字を生成するために機械学習モデルを試したところ、既にオープンソースライブラリがあることがわかりました。手書きロボットを構築するため、Amazonでペンプロッタを購入し、工業用ロボットアームで自動化を実現しました。
titles: 自動化プロダクションラインで手書きの手紙を作成するように自作ロボットを調整
オープンソースライブラリを使用する必要があるほど手書きの信憑性を向上するために機械学習モデルを調整する
安価なペンプロッターと産業用ロボットアームを使用して手紙の自動化読み込みシステムを製作
細かな詳細に囚われずにプロジェクトを進めることが大切であることを再確認
手書きの手紙を自動製作するための補助装置を自作する者のための記事
